Edited May 27, 2013 by OdinYggd

Do you have any problems with wobble on your planes? When I try to shoot the plane slides back and forth meaning barely any shoots hit. That and my planes seem to have a love of the ocean during a carrier take off despite what the elevators say.

Not really. What plane are you having problems with?

So far mine handles about like I expected, other than the elevator control being inverted and the throttle keys not being what I am used to.

Just won my first mission. Took out an AA gun on the first try, although I did get shot down shortly after- had a guy pelting me from behind, and I was at too low an altitude to shake him.

You know you're in a bind when you can see your wing melting from the hail of bullets coming at you.

I'm not used to flying planes again, I haven't played a simulator in over a year. I've done a few missions-destroyed some ground vehicles, sometimes through crashing . And a plane shot down but it really crashed when it was being shot at.

I haven't been shot down so much as crashing while flying low and at low engine power to give me a longer strafing run. I love the way damage happens in the game and the way you can crash land.

Are you playing on arcade or historical? On Arcade there shouldn't be any wobble at all. Historical will need quite a bit of time to get good at.

Also check your FPS, I find it extremely difficult to hit anything with low FPS. The Ping itself is spikey enough.

And check out some of the tactics of wwII aces, some of them work ingame. But with some planes you are screwed either way once you got someone on your back.

As noob russian planes are very good (Overpowered flying tanks with great firepower). Germans ... perform as usual for a game made by a russian company. If you choose them make sure you have an altitude / speed advantage before you engage - most of them turn like a lorry filled with bricks.

I tend to have the most fun with the Brits though. Hurricane I and II are lots of fun early on.
